snippet: Fires engulfed two factories in two major cities, killing more than 300 and reviving long-running questions about the regulation of the country’s manufacturing sector.
abstract: Fire ravages a textile factory complex in the commercial hub of Karachi, killing almost 300 workers trapped behind locked doors and raising questions about the woeful lack of regulation in a vital sector of Pakistan’s faltering economy; fires erupt just hours after shoe factory fire in Lahore that kills 25 and wounds dozens.

byline.original: By ZIA ur-REHMAN, DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD
byline.contributor: Waqar Gillani contributed reporting from Lahore, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Fires engulfed two factories in two major cities, killing more than 300 and reviving long-running questions about the regulation of the country’s manufacturing sector.

headline.seo: Pakistan Factory Fires Kill More Than 300
headline.main: More Than 300 Killed in Pakistani Factory Fires
headline.print_headline: Lax Regulations Blamed as Fires Kill Hundreds In Pakistan
